intro: Guarea oblonga, commonly known as the broadleaf guarea, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes trees known for their aromatic wood and medicinal properties. The plant features large, palmately lobed leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in axillary or terminal inflorescences. The tree produces woody, elongated fruits that contain flat, winged seeds, aiding in wind dispersal.
